name: US States in Songs Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: Classic Rock: "Deacon Blues" (Steely Dan): What state is mentioned in the chorus?
questions.explanation:
Alabama.

	"They got a name for the winners in the world/I want a name when I lose/They call Alabama the Crimson Tide/Call me Deacon Blues."

questions.text: Oldies: From what state do The Beach Boys wish all pretty girls came?
questions.explanation:
California.

	"I wish they all could be California.../I wish they all could be California.../I wish they all could be California girls."

questions.text: Country: "Take Me Home, Country Roads" (John Denver): Which is the state that Denver sings that his home is at?
questions.explanation:
West Virginia.

	"Take me home, country roads/To the place I belong/West Virginia, mountain mama/Take me home, country roads."

questions.text: Classic Rock: "Take It Easy" (The Eagles): In which state does the singer see "a girl (My Lord!) in a flat-bed Ford, slowin' down to take a look at me"?
questions.explanation:
Arizona.

	"Well, I'm a standin' on a corner in Winslow, Arizona/and such a fine sight to see:/it's a girl (my Lord!) in a flat-bed Ford/slowin' down to take a look at me."

questions.text: Broadway Musical: In what state does the wind "come sweepin' down the plain"?
questions.explanation:
oklahoma & OK.

	"Oklahoma, where the wind comes sweepin' down the plain/And the wavin' wheat can sure smell sweet/When the wind comes right behind the rain./Oklahoma, Ev'ry night my honey lamb and I/Sit alone and talk and watch a hawk/Makin' lazy circles in the sky."

questions.text: TV Themes: "The Beverly Hillbillies": What state name is part of a metaphor for oil?
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	"Come and listen to a story about a man named Jed/A poor mountaineer, barely kept his family fed,/Then one day he was shootin' at some food,/And up through the ground came a bubblin' crude./Oil that is, black gold, Texas tea."

questions.text: Classic Rock: (Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young): In which state were the Kent State University protests quelled by unwarranted gunfire from National Guard troops?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	"Tin soldiers and Nixon coming,/We're finally on our own./This summer I hear the drumming,/Four dead in Ohio."

questions.text: Frank Sinatra: if he can make it there, he can make it anywhere.  In which state is the city he's singing about?
questions.correct: New York & NY & nyc & new york city
questions.explanation:
New York & NY & nyc & new york city.

	"If I can make it there/I'm gonna make it/Anywhere/It's up to you/New York, New York.""

questions.text: Classic Rock: (Mountain): What is the name of the Cajun lady who taught the singer everything?  (_______ Queen)
questions.explanation:
Mississippi.

	"Mississippi Queen - you know what I mean /Mississippi Queen - she taught me everything."

questions.text: Folk: (Johnny Horton): To what state do prospectors rush to in 1892?
questions.explanation:
Alaska.

	"Where the river is windin'/Big nuggets they're findin'/North to Alaska/Go north, the rush is on."
